column4: hmm ok - someone said it was in Synaptic, and I think I need it to fix a KVM problem
yikes ;)
what does linux-image-2.6.11-1-686 do?
heh I'll try it, I'm a n00b and i'll only learn by trying :)
ok thanks - I'm just playing at the moment and have nothing to lose, I can always just reinstall
hi sly
hehe... well I am when it comes to the guts of Linux ;)
if you feel like you wanna do more hard-core "adventuring" to the unstable world, get breezy ;)
was that difficult to do?
noopes

if you want to use breezy repos for something... just "sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list" and then comment out your installation CD and backports if you have those.. and for all the other rep-links put "breezy" instead of "hoary", save it, do "sudo apt-get update" and then run synaptic , browse for the "Base System", check the kernel version you want to install and install it.
but dont do apt-get upgrade with breezy repos or you will end up with complete (and propably partly broken) breezy system
I'll try that - cheers
if it worked with a previous kernel, then just press esc while in grub at reboot and select the previous kernel you used
thanks, the previous kernel works
I think I've done the sources.list thing, which package do I need from "Base System"? linux-image-686?
wait a bit
yea linux-image<version you want>.i686 is right for the newest kernel on the i686 system
are you surfing the breezy repos?
sorry, I forgot to do apt-get update!
do it but dont, DONT! do upgrade :D
seems to be working, just got to wait for it to download (only on 512K broadband) - brb
thanks, the kernel upgrade worked :)
remember to edit back to hoary repos
